definition: a two-man saw/fig. to-and-fro between two sides
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
a saw/to cut with a saw

sentences.english: It was the beginning of another long week.
sentences.chinese: 這只是一場持續一週的拉鋸戰的開始。

sentences.english: Dark energy basically works against gravity in a tug-of-war.
sentences.chinese: 大體上，暗能量在與引力展開一場拉鋸戰。

sentences.english: She was sawing (away at) the bread with a blunt knife.
sentences.chinese: 她正在用一把鈍刀拉鋸般地切著麪包。

sentences.english: He sawed the towel across his back.
The some people brushes teeth the elephant pulls to saw, and also be thwart brush.
sentences.chinese: 有些人刷牙象拉鋸，也就是橫着刷。

sentences.english: The fight against AIDS will be a long drawn fight.
sentences.chinese: 與艾滋病的鬥爭將會是一場曠日持久的拉鋸戰。

sentences.english: She was sawing (away at) the bread with a blunt knife .
sentences.chinese: 她正在用一把鈍刀拉鋸般地切着麪包。

sentences.english: The Empty City Trick presents a kind of seesaw movement between the works and the viewers.
sentences.chinese: “空城計”上演了一場作品與觀者之間的拉鋸運動。

sentences.english: He sawed at the loaf of bread with his knife.
sentences.chinese: 他象拉鋸那樣用刀切面包。

definition: to lose what one has just obtained (idiom)
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
